oai_dc:dc.dc:title: List of stores transferred to Lieutenant Abram Pelham
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Funeral rites and ceremonies -- United States; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Equipment and supplies; Wainwright, William Alonzo, 1832-1904; United States -- Army -- Quartermaster Corps; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Printed form listing stores transferred to Lieutenant Abram Pelham, 13th Michigan Infantry, on June 17, 1864, at Tullahoma, Tennessee. "Received, Nashville, June 17, 1864 of Wainwright, Nashville, the following list of Quartermaster Stores: 25 Coffins."
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Quartermaster's Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Record Group 21, Adjutant General's Office Records, 1796-1900
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: After 1862, the Quartermaster Department assumed responsibility for the burial of war dead and the care of national cemeteries. The 13th Michigan Infantry Regiment lost a total of 388 men during service: four officers and 68 enlisted men were killed or mortally wounded; two officers and 314 enlisted men died of disease.
